metadata.title: There are 5 kinds of data scientists. Which one are you? | Towards Data Science
metadata.h1: There are 5 kinds of data scientists
metadata.description: In this article, I will be sharing what kind of roles exists in the industry infamously referred to as “data scientists” and debunking the rockstar data scientists requirements. As companies begin to…

outgoing_paragraph_urls.anchor_text: A little delusion can be healthy

all_paragraphs: In this article, I will be sharing what kind of roles exists in the industry infamously referred to as “data scientists” and debunking the rockstar data scientists requirements.
As companies begin to understand data science product life cycles for their business processes, the expectations of these role and responsibilities are dynamically changing.
Often I hear, I am a data scientist too. But, how is that my job entirely different from the other person who holds the same title?
Let’s debunk the roles and name them out!

One of the things I love absolutely about this profession is that one can’t just simply be a statistician, a quick programmer, or an experiment modeller. The role requires multiple technical and soft skills while being bias to the action. That is easier said than done - yet, this is exactly what companies are seemingly exploiting, more so unwittingly.
Here is what one could be:
The jack of all trades and master of one!
What companies who have no data science roadmaps want:
The jack of all trades and master of ALL!
There are FIVE kinds of data scientist roles I have categorised based on my past experiences, interviews & offers.
And, for the mercy of sciences, there is NO WAY a single person is fit for all kinds of roles.
Let’s begin diving into each one of them.
The hacker ones are usually required in startup companies. Usually, they look for the following skills:

As by definition, you know what a hacker is and it might be evident how these skills are valued in a startup environment where there are a lot of hats to be worn. They are hacker scientists spending their effort in data sciences and its pipeline end to end, from more of a ad-hoc point-of-view. And, trust me they enjoy it to their fullest!
Data Scientist → Senior Data Scientist → Lead Data Scientist →Chief Data Scientist → Head of Data Science

This role is more about analysing big-ish data and insights from that data, rather than a core focus on modelling. These roles are something you will love, if you are more interested in finding the answers and exploring depths of data analytics. There might be little to no modelling in a few roles.
Data Analyst → Senior Data Analyst→ Analytics Lead→ Head Analytics → Chief Data Officer

Data Scientist is more of a professional role, catering to business solutions and needs. But, if you are looking forward to bringing your craziest AI algorithm ideas to life and in general want to push boundaries, you are probably into research.
Research Data Scientists dive deep into algorithms, create new ones, publish papers, perhaps do a PhD, escape the hype and start creating it instead!
Research Associate→ Research Scientist→ Senior Researcher → Head of Research
Most commonly known as Software Engineering in Machine learning. The role is more inclined towards deployment and delivering scalable machine learning features.
Machine Learning Engineer → SDE II → SDE III → Data Science Manager → Director Engineering

A customer data scientist perfects in marketing the art of data sciences and is able to successfully translate the capabilities into the business conversation and is able to guide the clients to understand what they really need.

In order to deliver AI as a value addition, one needs to understand not only the algorithm but also the feasibility and the viability, making businesses appreciative of what AI products can deliver and understand the market fit.
This field is relatively new, so I haven’t seen many career paths in this front. But, the role is definitely leaning towards the business side.
Customer Data Scientist → Associate Consultant → Senior Consultant → Director Sales/Marketing

As you see, there is so much more nuance and complications to a title one would broadly categorise as “data scientist”. So, for all those who are looking for the rockstar data scientists — Don’t, because they don’t exist.
While some people may claim to be they are or they’ve found one — that’s great! A little delusion can be healthy.

Data scientists, coming from various backgrounds, who worked up this exciting trade of our times, teaching those machines to learn on their own while specializing in the stuff they all love - are already rockstar enough.
Hope this article helped you understand the industry expectations and kinds of data scientists there are out in the open.

Let me know, if you are an aspiring data scientist or looking forward to making a transition in the career. Feel free to ping me on my DMs, I will make sure to reply to all the DMs. Keep it going. And remember,
Your home for data science. A Medium publication sharing concepts, ideas and codes.
Kaggle Grandmaster 🏅| 👨🏻‍💻 Data Scientist | TensorFlow Dev 🔥
